text: The studies were conducted in settings that use cytologic analysis as a stand-alone, first-level test, with different strategies of referral for colposcopy.Overall, as compared with conventional cytologic analysis, liquid-based cytologic analysis had a similar or higher sensitivity for the detection of cervical intraepithelial neoplasia (CIN) of grade 2 or higher $( \mathrm { C I N } 2 + )$ and grade 3 or higher $( \mathrm { C I N } 3 + )$ , a similar or lower specificity and positive predictive value, and a lower proportion of unsatisfactory slides.
